cs445.a4

Interface VideoEngine


  • public interface VideoEngine
    This abstract data type is a predictive engine for video ratings in a streaming video system. It stores a set of users, a set of videos, and a set of ratings that users have assigned to videos. It is assumed that wherever a parameter of type Video is passed, it can be a subclass of Video such as a Film or TvEpisode.

    • Method Detail

      • addVideo

        boolean addVideo(Video theVideo)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 SystemFullException
        Adds a new video to the system, avoiding duplicates.

        If theVideo is not null, the system does not contain theVideo, and the system has available capacity, then addVideo modifies the system so that it contains theVideo. All other entries remain unmodified.

        If theVideo is null, then add throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the system. If the system already contains theVideo, then addVideo returns false without modifying the system. If the system has a capacity limit, and does not have available capacity, then add throws SystemFullException without modifying the set.

        Parameters:
        theVideo - video to be added
        Returns:
        true if theVideo was added, false if it was not added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theVideo is null
        SystemFullException - if the system does not have the capacity to store an additional entry

      • removeVideo

        boolean removeVideo(Video theVideo)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    java.lang.NullPointerException
        Removes a specific video from the system, if possible.

        If this system contains theVideo, removeVideo will modify the system so that it no longer contains the video. All other entries remain unmodified.

        If this system does not contain theVideo, removeVideo will return false without modifying the system. If theVideo is null, removeVideo throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the set.

        If the system is empty, removeVideo throws NullPointerException.

        Parameters:
        theVideo - video to be removed
        Returns:
        true if theVideo was removed, false if it was not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the system is empty.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theVideo is null

      • addToSeries

        boolean addToSeries(TvEpisode episode,
                    TvSeries series)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    SeriesFullException
        Adds an existing television episode to an existing television series.

        If episode and series are not null, and both episode and series are in the system, addToSeries will modify series so that it contains episode. If series already contains episode, addToSeries will return false without modifying series.

        If either episode or series is null, or if system does not contain either episode or series, addToSeries throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying series. If series has a capacity limit and it is reached, addToSeries throws SeriesFullException

        Parameters:
        episode - the episode to be added to series
        series - the series the episode will be added to
        Returns:
        true if episode was added to the series, false if it was not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either episode or system is null, or if the system does not contain either series or episode
        SeriesFullException - if the series has a capacity limit and it has been reached and episode cannot be added

      • removeFromSeries

        boolean removeFromSeries(TvSeries series,
                         TvEpisode episode)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes an existing television episode from an existing television series.

        If the system does not contain either series or episode, removeFromSeries throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the system. If either the series or episode is null, removeFromSeries throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the system.If the system contains episode, but series does not contain episode, removeFromSeries throws IllegalArgumentException.

        If the system contains both the series and the episode, and the series contains episode, removeFromSeries will modify the series so that episode is no longer in series. However, the episode will still remain in the system and all other entries remain unmodified.

        Parameters:
        episode - the episode to be removed
        series - the series from which the episode will be removed
        Returns:
        true if the removal was successful; false if not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the episode or series is null, if the system does not contain either the episode or series, or if series does not contain episode.

      • rateVideo

        void rateVideo(double rating,
               User theUser,
               Video theVideo)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets a user's rating for a video, as a number of stars from 1 to 5.

        If the rating is not null and the system contains both theUser and theVideo, rateVideo sets the theUser's rating for theVideo to the rating. If theUser has already rated theVideo, rateVideo replaces previous rating with the new one.

        If the rating is less than 1 or greater than 5, rateVideo throws an IllegalArgumentException. If theUser or theVideo are null, or if the system does not contain theUser or theVideo, rateVideo throws IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        rating - the rating to be set
        theUser - user whose rating to set
        theVideo - video that is to be rated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rating is not a number between 1(inclusive)-5(inclusive), if either theUser or theVideo are null, or if system does not contain theUser or theVideo

      • clearRating

        void clearRating(User theUser,
                 Video theVideo)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Clears a user's rating on a video. If this user has rated this video and the rating has not already been cleared, then the rating is cleared and the state will appear as if the rating was never made. If this user has not rated this video, or if the rating has already been cleared, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user whose rating should be cleared
        theVideo - video from which the user's rating should be cleared
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not currently have a rating on record for the video
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the video is null

      • predictRating

        double predictRating(User theUser,
                     Video theVideo)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Predicts the rating a user will assign to a video that they have not yet rated, as a number of stars from 1 to 5. If theUser and theVideo exist in the system, predictRating will predict how theUser will rate theVideo.

        If either theVideo or theUser is null, or if theUser does not exist in the system, or if theVideo does not exist in the system, predictRating throws IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:
        theVideo - which the rating will be assigned to
        theUser - whose rating to predict
        Returns:
        rating that was predicted. If theUser has already rated theVideo, return null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is theUser or theVideo cannot be found in the system, or if either theUser or theVideo are null

      • suggestVideo

        Video suggestVideo(User theUser)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Suggests a video for a user (e.g.,based on their predicted ratings). This returns a video for the user to watch.

        It uses information about theUser to suggest a video. It should not suggest a video that theUser has already rated or watched.

        If theUser is null or if theUser is not found in the sytem, suggestVideo throws IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        theUser - the user the video will be suggested to
        Returns:
        The video to suggest, or null if no suitable video was found (i.e. theUser has watched all the videos in the system or the system contains no videos)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theUser is not found in the system or theUser is null
